top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Locos’s 157-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Racing Gravel Locos isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Gravel Locos intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Gravel Locos’s smooth limestone gravel, fast hill country ranch roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
At 157 miles, Gravel Locos rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Gravel Locos’s smooth, fast hill country gravel with endless rollers and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Locos when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Gravel Locos rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Gravel Locos’s 7,884ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Gravel Locos’s smooth, fast hill country gravel with endless rollers delivers on race day.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Locos. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Locos — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on smooth, fast hill country gravel with endless rollers.

race_overlay.heat: May in Hico, Texas — Late May means starting warm and climbing into 80s-90s°F with high sun. 2022's Wahoo reading of 120°F on fresh tarmac shows how brutal heat reflection can be. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Gravel Locos — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Heat and sun on open ranch roads; Dehydration risk is the primary concern.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 157 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 157 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Locos requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on smooth, fast hill country gravel with endless rollers to build confidence. Expect: smooth limestone gravel, fast hill country ranch roads, wildflower-lined paths.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Endurance to prepare you for 157 miles of smooth, fast hill country gravel with endless rollers in Hico, Texas.
